location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 366: Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Taylour Thomson, Her Majesty's Chargé d'Affaires at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: In this letter Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, refers to his letter of 18 October, which concerned the case of slaves being imported on the Mahomedeebuglah, under British colours. Kemball informs William Taylour Thomson, Her Majesty's Chargé d'Affaires at the Court of Persia, that he has suspended for the present the delivery of the vezirial [vizerial] letter which was transmitted with the latter's despatch of 20 October. Kemball suggests that any penalty which the Persian Government decides to inflict should be suffered by the owner and not by the nakhoda of the boat.
